Key Match Events: Pete Crow-Armstrong made three incredible catches in center, including a game-ending home run robbery of Max Muncy.
Dansby Swanson reached first base on a throwing error by catcher Austin Barnes, and Seiya Suzuki ripped an RBI single to center, bringing home Swanson with the tying run.
Suzuki came all the way around from second to plate the go-ahead run, and Nico Hoerner added an RBI double and PCA had an RBI groundout to give the Cubs a 6-3 lead.
Post-Match Reflections: The Cubs have to be thrilled with the development of Pete Crow-Armstrong over the last two months and it should mean big things starting next year.
If he keeps this pace up, maybe Chicago can even make things interesting here in the last three weeks of 2024.
